findings.title: Predictable randomness using block timestamp
findings.explanation: The function randomGen returns block.timestamp which can be manipulated by miners and is not suitable for generating secure randomness.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a secure randomness source such as a commit–reveal scheme or an oracle-based solution like Chainlink VRF.

findings.title: Unchecked send return value
findings.explanation: The contract uses send to transfer Ether but does not check its boolean return value, which can lead to silent failures or locked funds if the transfer fails.
findings.fix_suggestion: Check the return value of send and revert on failure, or use transfer (which reverts on failure) or a pull-payment pattern.
